sentences: See on hullem kui eelmisel korral.
Tegelikult oli see hulgem kui m√µeldud.
context: The word 'hullem' is the comparative form of the adjective 'halb' (bad) in Estonian. It means 'worse' or 'more severe/serious'. This is used when comparing two things and indicating that one has a lesser quality than another, specifically in terms of being more negative or problematic.
